oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Marks Presbyterian Church: front view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Kyle and Hasson Streets, Rogersville, Hawkins Co., TN

Color photograph of a large, white, wood-framed church that rests on a red brick foundation. The sanctuary level of the building is notable for the decorative wood trim, prominent stained glass windows and a single tower to the left of a high peaked roof. Two sets of stairs lead to twin entrance doors on each side of the building.

St. Marks Presbyterian church was founded ca. 1875 by Reverend William H. Franklin, also pastor. It is significantly associated with Swift College, an African American institution in Upper East Tennessee from 1883 to the mid-1960s. The church ministered to the faculty, students, and community of Swift. The church dissolved on July 21, 2002.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Church buildings -- Tennessee
